properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 8:03AM MST until February 12 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...Snow and Wind to Continue This Morning...

.Another weather system is move through Montana and northern
Wyoming this morning, bringing some snow and strong wind to
north-central Wyoming. Travel conditions could be hazardous
Wednesday morning in northern Johnson County.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Just over an inch of snow has fallen so
far. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches, with locally
higher amounts in the foothills. Winds at the Johnson County
Airport gusted to 42 mph between 6 and 7 AM this morning. North
wind 20 to 30 mph with gusts as high as 40 to 45 mph can be
expected.

* WHERE...Northeast Johnson County.

* WHEN...From 3 AM to noon MST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow will
significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will
impact the morning commute, especially along Interstate 90 in
northern Johnson County and around Buffalo.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TODAY
